contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} {{For|other people with a similar name|Victor de Broglie (disambiguation){{!}}Victor de Broglie|}} [[Image:Victor-Maurice de Broglie.jpg|thumb|right|180px|Victor-Maurice de Broglie]] '''Victor-Maurice, comte de Broglie''' (12 March 1647 – 4 August 1727) was a [[France|French]] [[soldier]] and [[general]]. Victor-Maurice de Broglie was born in the De Broglie house, a noble family originally from [[Piedmont]]. He was the son of [[François-Marie, comte de Broglie]] and Angelique de Vassal, Countess of [[Favria]]. After the death of his father he inherited [[Revel]] Counties and de Broglie, the marquisate of [[Senonches]] and also received the Government of La Bassee, near [[Lille]]. He served under [[Louis II de Bourbon, Prince de Condé|Condé]], [[Henri de la Tour d'Auvergne, Vicomte de Turenne|Turenne]], and other commanders of the age of [[Louis XIV of France|Louis XIV]] in the [[Franco-Dutch War]] and other conflicts. He was named ''[[maréchal de camp]]'' in 1676, [[lieutenant-general]] in 1688, and finally [[marshal of France]] in 1724, just three years before his death. He had three sons, one of whom predeceased him. The second son, [[Charles-Guillaume, marquis de Broglie]], was his heir, while the third son, [[François-Marie, 1st duc de Broglie|François-Marie]], a general and a marshal of France like his father, became the first [[duc de Broglie]]. {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Broglie, Victor-Maurice, Comte De | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 12 March 1647 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 4 August 1727 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Broglie, Victor-Maurice, Comte De}} [[Category:Marshals of France]] [[Category:Counts of Broglie]] [[Category:1647 births]] [[Category:1727 deaths]] {{France-noble-stub}}
